bug.author: jlewi
bug.summary: central dashboard (RC) takes a really long time to load
bug.description:
/kind bug I'm testing out the upcoming central dashboard gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/centraldashboard:v20190808-v0.6.2-rc.0-0-g65583158 When I first go to the page I get a blank screen even though chrome tools shows a bunch of successful requests. It looks like the following request is returning a 502 <denchmark-code>vendor.bundle.js:765 GET https://jlewi-0-6-2-rc.endpoints.jlewi-dev.cloud.goog/api/workgroup/exists 502 send @ vendor.bundle.js:765 generateRequest @ vendor.bundle.js:765 (anonymous) @ vendor.bundle.js:765 (anonymous) @ vendor.bundle.js:1 window.MutationObserver.observe.characterData @ vendor.bundle.js:1 characterData (async) run @ vendor.bundle.js:1 async @ vendor.bundle.js:1051 _nameChanged @ vendor.bundle.js:1051 L @ vendor.bundle.js:825 w @ vendor.bundle.js:825 M @ vendor.bundle.js:825 _propertiesChanged @ vendor.bundle.js:825 _flushProperties @ vendor.bundle.js:1657 _flushProperties @ vendor.bundle.js:825 ready @ vendor.bundle.js:825 ready @ vendor.bundle.js:825 ready @ vendor.bundle.js:1051 ready @ vendor.bundle.js:1051 ready @ vendor.bundle.js:1657 _enableProperties @ vendor.bundle.js:1657 connectedCallback @ vendor.bundle.js:825 connectedCallback @ vendor.bundle.js:825 connectedCallback @ vendor.bundle.js:1051 connectedCallback @ vendor.bundle.js:1051 (anonymous) @ vendor.bundle.js:686 i @ app.bundle.js:1 371 @ app.bundle.js:1 i @ app.bundle.js:1 t @ app.bundle.js:1 280 @ app.bundle.js:1 (anonymous) @ app.bundle.js:1 (anonymous) @ app.bundle.js:1 (anonymous) @ app.bundle.js:1 </denchmark-code>
And takes 1 minute. if I wait the page successfully renders I do have a profile <denchmark-code>kubectl get profiles NAME AGE kubeflow-jlewi 30m </denchmark-code>
/assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/avdaredevil>@avdaredevil</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.99. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

I'm not able to select any namespaces. I also do not see any admin option to create profiles. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/777219/63144147-69157100-bfa6-11e9-93bf-b70ae503626f.png></denchmark-link>

kfam server is running and shows no errrors in logs <denchmark-code>kubectl -n kubeflow logs profiles-deployment-85c56cc7c-v2hwq kfam time="2019-08-16T04:14:29Z" level=info msg="Server started" </denchmark-code>

Here's the virtual service for kfam <denchmark-code>apiVersion: networking.istio.io/v1alpha3 kind: VirtualService metadata: creationTimestamp: 2019-08-16T04:13:18Z generation: 1 name: kfam namespace: kubeflow resourceVersion: "4557" selfLink: /apis/networking.istio.io/v1alpha3/namespaces/kubeflow/virtualservices/kfam uid: 2d55574c-bfdc-11e9-82c7-42010a8e010d spec: gateways: - kubeflow-gateway hosts: - '*' http: - headers: request: add: x-forwarded-prefix: /kfam match: - uri: prefix: /kfam/ rewrite: uri: /kfam/ route: - destination: host: profiles-kfam.kubeflow.svc.cluster.local port: number: 8081 </denchmark-code>
So is the URL wrong?

I think that's a red herring; I think the client side JS talks to the centraldashboard backend. Here are the logs for the centraldashboard <denchmark-code>. (rejection id: 24) (node:29) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:8084 at TCPConnectWrap.afterConnect [as oncomplete] (net.js:1106:14) (node:29) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Unhandled promise rejection. This error originated either by throwing inside of an async function without a catch block, or by rejecting a promise which was not handled with .catch(). (rejection id: 25) (node:29) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:8084 at TCPConnectWrap.afterConnect [as oncomplete] (net.js:1106:14) (node:29) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Unhandled promise rejection. This error originated either by throwing inside of an async function without a catch block, or by rejecting a promise which was not handled with .catch(). (rejection id: 26) </denchmark-code>

I think this is the issue with the centraldashboard relying on environment variables to set the URL of the backend. I deleted the centraldashboard pod. Now centraldashboard starts and I see the following in the logs <denchmark-code>> kubeflow-centraldashboard@0.0.2 start /app > npm run serve
> kubeflow-centraldashboard@0.0.2 serve /app > node dist/server.js
Initializing Kubernetes configuration Using Profiles service at http://10.55.255.198:8081/kfam Server listening on port http://localhost:8082 </denchmark-code>
Now I'm able to load the centraldasbhoard without delay and I can see my namespace.
